title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 107/2003 of 21 January 2003 determining the extent to which applications for import licences lodged in respect of subquota II for frozen meat of bovine animals, provided for in Regulation (EC) No 954/2002, can be accepted
header:
Commission Regulation (EC) No 107/2003
of 21 January 2003
determining the extent to which applications for import licences lodged in respect of subquota II for frozen meat of bovine animals, provided for in Regulation (EC) No 954/2002, can be accepted
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Community,
Having regard to Commission Regulation (EC) No 954/2002 of 4 June 2002 opening and providing for the administration of a tariff quota for frozen meat of bovine animals covered by CN code 0202 and products covered by CN code 0206 29 91 (1 July 2002 to 30 June (2003)(1), and in particular Article 12(4) thereof,
Whereas:
Article 12(2) of Regulation (EC) No 954/2002 fixes at 13250 tonnes the quantity of subquota II in respect of which approved operators can lodge an application for an import licence based on imports in the period 7 to 9 January 2003. As the import licences applied for exceed the available quantity, a reduction coefficient should be fixed in accordance with Article 12(4) of Regulation (EC) No 954/2002,
main_body: Each application for an import licence lodged in accordance with Article 12(2) of Regulation (EC) No 954/2002 in the period 7 to 9 January 2003 shall be accepted at a rate of 2,5754 % of the quantities applied for.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 22 January 2003.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 21 January 2003.
For the Commission
J. M. Silva RodrĂ­guez
Agriculture Director-General
(1) OJ L 147, 5.6.2002, p. 8.
